content.description: Fun limestone slab climb with small crimpers for hand holds and excellent feet.
content.protection: 5 bolts to chains, shared anchor with Little Bighorn.  Some of the rock around the anchor is a little loose but the anchor is solidly placed.
content.location: Second route from left on the down hill slope side of the belay area.

climbs.name: Shape Shifter
climbs.fa: Ron Brunckhorst, Alana Meuller, Deborah Pratt, Jerry Furtney (05/2007)

content.description: Starts with a nice face slab climb then transitions into a decent hand crack.
content.protection: 3 bolts to stoppers, chain anchor at a solid ledge that is shared with Gold Digger.
content.location: Third route from the left between Sheepeaters and Gold Digger.

content.description: Start with a small overhang then transition to a slightly slabby climb before coming to a corner that allows some stemming.  The formation to the left and near the anchor is a little loose.
content.protection: 5 bolts to chains, shares anchor with The Sheep Eaters.
content.location: Far left route just at the edge of the belay spot.

content.description: Starts with a nice face climb and transitions upwards to balancy moves with crimpy hands and great feet.
content.protection: 5 bolts to chain anchor located at a nice big ledge.  Anchor is shared with Shape Shifter.
content.location: Farthest right route located just left of the big pine tree at the base.
